There’s a decent number of threads asking similar questions. I’d recommend reading these first few, recent threads first:

Should we use Fusion or Onshape Next Season? CAD
Currently our team is using Autodesk Fusion to CAD and machine our robot, but I’ve heard that many of the other FRC teams use OnShape, so I’m wondering what people like about each of them and what anyone reading would recommend. With the offseason coming up soon, I’d like to get this figured out so we can get everyone properly trained without having to switch midway through the offseason. Thanks!
Which is the preferred CAD system and more?! CAD
Which CAD system do we all prefer nowadays? ALSO, do you have a keyboard shortcut list that you look at to help during the process?

I really love Onshape much more than Fusion because it’s much easier for all laptops to render and is pretty seamless in switching devices. Since everything is totally web-browser and cloud-based, I constantly change from my home desktop to my school laptop. It’s not the best in terms of cad capabilities though, so if you’re trying to cad some crazy stuff it makes it hard. But for FRC, I get by completely fine with Onshape, and a lot of the amazing feature scripts.
TLDR, Onshape better use across devices and free, but worse CAD abilities. Fusion better CAD but a pain to use on multiple devices. Both work for FRC just fine, Onshape is just easier
